oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of the uniform Christopher Ammons wore upon leaving Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs of the olive drab uniform Chris was wearing when he left Vietnam. Patches from the 1st Infantry Division (with whom he served in his first tour) and the 1st Signals Brigade (to whom his MP Company was attached on his second tour) are visible on the sleeves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Soldiers; Uniforms
Ammons. Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army/ Military Police Company, 194th; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons. Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army June 1, 1967, and served first with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
